sentences.en: Be thrifty and hardworking in whatever undertaking you are to start on.
But memories of her early straits had made her excessively thrifty.
sentences.cn: 然而,由于对昔日的艰苦岁月记忆犹新,她生活过分检朴.

sentences.en: Except for smoking and drinking, he is a thrifty man.
sentences.cn: 除了抽烟、喝酒, 他是个生活节俭的人.

sentences.en: Except for smoking and drinking,he is a thrifty man.
sentences.cn: 除了抽烟、喝酒，他是个生活节俭的人。

sentences.en: In order to run an efficient household, you have to be thrifty.
sentences.cn: 居家过日, 以俭为本.

sentences.en: It is thrifty to prepare today for the wants of tomorrow.
sentences.cn: 节俭就是今天为明天的需要作准备.

sentences.en: Lei Feng, always thrifty, had saved this sum from his allowances.
sentences.cn: 雷锋一向节省, 这笔钱是他从津贴中省下来的.

sentences.en: My mother taught me to be thrifty.
sentences.cn: 我妈妈教我生活要节俭。

sentences.en: My mother was of a thrifty habit.
She was a thrifty woman and managed to put aside some money every month.
sentences.cn: 她是个很会持家的妇女,每月都设法存些钱.

sentences.en: She was pretty, young, anxious, to better herself and thrifty.
sentences.cn: 她美, 她年轻, 她要强,她勤俭.

sentences.en: The thrifty farmer seldom indulged himself with good food.
sentences.cn: 那个节俭的农民难得吃好菜好饭让自己“享受”一下.

sentences.en: The thrifty farmer seldom, if ever, indulged himself with good food.
sentences.cn: 那个节俭的农民难得吃好菜好饭让自己享受一下.

sentences.en: We will bring in a measure to be thrifty with raw materials.
sentences.cn: 我们要提出一项节约原材料的措施.

words.tran_cn: 浪费的，不节约的；无价值的
节俭；节约；[植] 海石竹
